resources.string: Remember to leave your Bluetooth and Location on, and we\'ll do the rest.
Together we can save lives and help people keep their jobs.
We will use your Bluetooth to monitor your distance from other devices.\nIt\'s anonymous!
We will use your Distance Monitoring to approximate more precisely your interactions.\nIt\'s anonymous!
To help doctors with the research and analysis of this crisis, \nyou can choose to anonymously send your Position.\nThis is not mandatory, and will only help if you decide to do so.
If you have been close to an infected person in the past two weeks, we will notify you.\n\nThat\'s it, just one notification.
We use the Bluetooth signal to anonymously detect the devices that get closer than 2 meters to you, and the time the two devices have been interacting for.
How do we maintain your anonymity?
We only save the interactions between your phone and the other devices, and how long it lasted for. We do not store any personal information or location history.
How do we keep you safe?
If one of your interactions of the past 14 days is diagnosed with Coronavirus, you will be notified.
How do we know who\'s sick?

Only professional medical staff can diagnose if a patient is positive to the virus. In that case, the doctor will scan the patient\'s QR code and notify the people that are at risk because they have been interacting with the infected patient.
What happens if you receive the notification that you could be at risk?
It means that you have been interacting with someone that has tested positive. \nProtect your loved ones by self-isolating for two weeks. \nCall your doctor in case you don\'t feel well.
What can you do to help?
Just leave this app running in the background, and we\'ll do the rest. \nIf you want to help us, share this app with your loved ones to keep them safe.
